# ChocAn System



# AI DISCLOSURE:
Artifical Intelligence was utilized to complete portions of this application. The AI service used was Cursor IDE, and it was used in contexts such as building test cases, refactoring, commenting, documentation, syntax errors and suggestions, logic errors, environment errors, and prototyping.

The following is a reference for all known cases of AI-edited or generated source code. 

**Note**: Documentation is more commonly generated by AI in this codebase, for thoroughness and efficiency sake. 


### AI References:

**ACMEAccountingServices.java**
| Line/Snippet | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `Lines 119-120` | Assigning a map of a string and double and a map of a string and serivce record list with the type of a HashMap |
| `Lines 126-136` | Assigning fee with the service fee, or catching it upon exception. This code snipped was alo used in lines 163-167 and lines 172-176|

**DataCenter.java**
| Line/Snippet | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `getServiceRecordsForLastWeek()` | This method was partially generated by AI as i did not understand the Java time library |
| `Lines 341` | My AI Agent suggested that i use the ArrayList function to initialize the result variable, this is also on line 352 |

**Manager.java**
| Line/Snippet | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `new java.util.Scanner(System.in)` | AI generated the scanner object in line 37 initially and explained its use as an input stream reader |
| `Line 61` | jave.time.temporal.WeekFields.ISO` | Used for a standard definition of a week for the weekField |
| `Lines 129-136` | Created maps for a summary of consultations and total fees, and a map of provider number to the provider object for quick lookup |
| `try (java.util.Scanner scanner = new java.util.Scanner(System.in))` | The AI Agent suggested wrapping the scanner declaration in a try/catch resource so that it automatically closes when the block is out of scope |
